productInformation.name: Operating System
productInformation.value: ‎Windows 7, Windows 8 / Mac OS X 10.6.8 or later

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 266 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Tough in the Field. Fast Everywhere. With the LaCie Rugged Thunderbolt, even if you go off-road, your project stays on time. With IP 54-rated resistance to the elements and blinding-fast speeds through Thunderbolt and USB 3.0, you don’t have to compromise between durability, mobility, and speed. Don't let your project get derailed by incompatibility between your external drive and your computer. With both USB 3.0 and Thunderbolt interfaces, the LaCie Rugged is a perfect match for your Mac and PC. Since USB 3.0 is backward compatible, you can connect it to any standard computer, anywhere. The integrated Thunderbolt cable also stows neatly when not in use, so that you’ll never lose it. The LaCie Rugged is also fully bus powered through the USB 3.0 and Thunderbolt cables. Its portability and interfaces make it the must-have sidekick to a Mac or Ultrabook.

No-Compromise Speed Get lightning-fast transfer speeds on Mac and PC thanks to the USB 3.0 and Thunderbolt interfaces. With the SSD version, the LaCie Rugged delivers up to 387 MB/s—one of the fastest bus-powered products available*. The hard disk version performs at up to 122 MB/s, a 35% improvement over FireWire 800. Back up and transfer mountains of data in a fraction of the time. Enjoy noticeably more responsive photo library browsing. *These transfer rates were achieved using AJA System Test with the SSD version connected to a Mac computer via the Thunderbolt interface. Actual data rates may vary depending on operating environment and other factors, such as chosen interface and disk capacity.

Edit with Creative Cloud Make stunning videos for film, TV, and web with a one-month membership to Adobe Creative Cloud All Apps plan. Explore the entire collection of desktop and mobile apps—ranging from essentials like Photoshop and Premiere Pro to innovative new tools like Adobe XD. ^One-month membership to Adobe Creative Cloud All Apps plan is redeemable during product registration. Internet connection and Adobe ID required. Available only to users 13 and older. Not available in all countries. See our official website for applicable terms and privacy policy.

All-Terrain Data Protection Your data is irreplaceable, so it’s vital to protect it against any conceivable mishap wherever you go. That's why LaCie made the Rugged tougher than ever. It’s MIL-compliant, which means that data is protected even during accidental drops of up to two meters (6.6 feet). During transit, connect the removable cover to provide IP 54-level protection against dust and water. Whether the LaCie Rugged falls out of your backpack or gets splashed by a mud puddle, you stay confident that your data is still accessible. The SSD version goes a step further for the ultimate in resilience against vibration and shock. Both versions are tough enough to be shipped for reliable delivery to clients or partners. Included software even protects your files from prying eyes with AES 256-bit encryption.

Features Automatic Backup Easy setup and automatic worry-free backup for both PC and Mac computers. Password Protection LaCie Private-Public software (available via download) ensures your files remain completely confidential. Thunderbolt on Windows You can connect this product to a Windows computer via the Thunderbolt connection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars EASY to open >>> Pricey but effective THUNDERBOLT ENCLOSURE.
reviews.reviewText: If you're still using a Mac with Thunderbolt 2 connections and are stuck using all kinds of workarounds to get decent transfer speeds from external storage then here's, well, another workaround! The cool thing about this drive is that it can be quickly & easily opened up rendering it a Thunderbolt drive enclosure. True, it's a pricey enclosure but good luck finding ANY Thunderbolt 2 enclosure otherwise. The Seagate HDD inside can be used for whatever (get an $8 USB 3 enclosure and give it to a friend or connect it to wi-fi and make it external storage for your phone!) and a sexy new SSD can be inserted in its place. The whole swap involves 6 screws and a little tape (AND the torching of the LaCie warranty, mind you...). There're YouTube tutorials to walk one through the 5-minute process. You'll ultimately be limited by the SATA connection (to around 6 Gb/s I think), but that's nothing to sneeze at, especially if you've been stuck using those lousy USB 2.0 ports. Thank goodness for USB-C - now if we can just get Apple to let go of crappy Lightning tech - egads. Anyhow, give your Mac the gift of long life with an easy peasy speed enhancement and postpone all that traitorous talk of impending retirement for the beloved beast.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great, my favorite brand.
reviews.reviewText: Love LaCie, use for my Mac and air backups. This is my second purchase of this brand, the other one 3 years old is still working great on my Big Mac, this is for my MacBook Air and the thunderbolt backs up fast!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid reliable drive in a cool orange jacket
reviews.reviewText: Backups. Backups. Backups. I have lost data before so I backup obsessively. This my second Rugged Thunderbolt and my third backup drive. For my Mac I have a Time Capsule that is one of these drives and another La Cie that I got with the computer. My original Apple Time Capsule and Wi-Fi router failed and I replaced it with one of these. This second one goes to the safe deposit vault at the bank and about every month I go and get it, back my data up and then return it to the bank. I have decades of my life on my computer and loosing it would be devastating so, ya I'm over the top in some peoples eyes but not mine.The drive is kind cool with it's orange jacket and built in Tbolt cable and I don't worry too much using it at home and in the office. Also it can be partitioned into two drives with one partition being Mac and the other being FAT32. Very easy to set up with software that comes on the drive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars practical, easy to use, and stores nicely
reviews.reviewText: So glad I purchased this external harddrive for my Mac. It’s super easy to use, and cheaper here than on the apple website. Plus, I love that i can take it with me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great, sturdy, compact
reviews.reviewText: Like size & sturdiness. When I'm gone on extended trips, can either take along, or store away easily. One glitch that is happening with backups of Mac Mini, and don't know whether it is Mac or this storage that is the problem. Have partitioned into 4 (for different Macs), and the backup partition to the Mini doesn't always mount. Usually able to get Disk Utility to mount, but occasionally can't right away. Have to eject all & try again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Connection ports are flimsy and will not stand any wear.
reviews.reviewText: The connection ports are extremely sensitive to any wear and cables must be attached just so. Cables not attached at a 90 degree angle for any lebgth of time will ruin the unit. I've gone through 2 of these with the same problem. Sure, you can probably yoss the Thunderbolt across the room with no problem. Just be extremely careful as to how you hook it up to your computer. I'll never buy another.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast, Sturdy, and Reliable Data Backup
reviews.reviewText: This external hard drive is fast, sturdy, and extremely reliable for backing up and encrypting your data.
Uso o HD para melhorar a mobilidade e troca de arquivos entre o desktop e o notebook. Conexão thunderbolt é rápida o suficiente para acesso e abertura de arquivos de projeto.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect solution to add SSD in an old iMac
reviews.reviewText: I bought this hard drive to upgrade my iMac late 2013. It's hard drive is so slow with recent versions of OSX and it is a pain to change it to a SSD because of the iMac window glued to the frame. Too risky to do it yourself and very expensive if done by an Apple certified partner.It's very easy to replace Lacie HDD by a SSD and plugged in thunderbolt mode, it give a serious boost to the iMac when OSX is installed on it.Lacie's HDD can be used in another USB case if needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Velocidad final limitada por el HD interno
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Hola amazónicos!!He adquirido el disco duro Lacie con Thunderbolt 2 y USB 3.0. 1TB.Es un producto que, por construcción, no se le puede poner pegas: fabricación en Aluminio y recubrimiento de goma/silicona que le protege, y bien, de las caídas. Comparado con los otros discos duros que tengo externos, es más voluminoso, pero no es incómodo de transportar y, gracias a su protección de silicona, se agarra bien y no desliza en ninguna superficie. Además tienes ese extra de protección.Para no hacer muy extensa la opinión, me voy a centrar en:+ Ventajas:- Protección frente a caídas y derrame de líquidos.- Construcción y acabados.- Soporte de la marca y software que viene incluido: con él, al empezar a usarlo, te da la opción de hacer una doble partición: una con tipo de archivo propietario de Apple (HFS+) y otra con archivos compatibles con el resto de sistemas Fat32 o exfat.- Registro y soporte de la marca Lacie (adquirida por Seagate).- Velocidad frente a otros HD externos USB 3.0, tanto con el propio cable USB como con el Thunderbolt.- Doble conexión: Thunderbolt 2 y USB 3.0.- Empaquetado desde distribuidor espectacular por protección. Un 10 en este aspecto.+Desventajas:- Tamaño mayor que otros discos duros externos de 2.5 de la competencia.- Precio alto, hasta 3 veces más caro que uno de la misma capacidad... Pero sin Thunderbolt 2, claro.+Inconveniente:- En comparación con discos duros externos con SSD y USB 3.0, es más lento en lectura y escritura de archivos. Me explico:He hecho pruebas con programas específicos que hacen pruebas y miden la velocidad de los discos duros con diferentes tipos de archivos. Y me han dado una máxima de 135-137 MB/S en escritura y 137-140 MB/S de lectura con Thunderbolt. Con la conexión USB unos 5 MB/S menos de media. Casi igual.Con una caja externa 3.0 y SSD con el mismo programa y ordenador (MacBook Pro i7 y 16GB De RAM) me ha dado resultados de 350MB/S de escritura y casi 400 de lectura.Por lo tanto, si este Lacie tuviera un SSD en su interior... Con Thunderbolt seguro que triplicaba la de este USB. Pero no voy a cambiar el interno por un SSD porque perdería la garantía... Además, con los datos que ofrece, para mi uso, me es suficiente.Espero que os sirva de ayuda esta parrafada.Saludos cordiales!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 17, 2016
reviews.reviewText: I've used LaCie drives for about 10 years now in both studio and location recording settings. I bought this to record on location so the heavy duty protection was quite important. I haven't dropped it yet - I don't really intend to - but it is a nice safety blanket.I have only used the thunderbolt connection, I'm still not sure of the speed of USB3 for recording and can't really afford dropouts. Runs at 7400 rpm, I had no disk read speed errors or connectivity problems. It works really well from the bus power on the laptop, but obviously running this and an audio interface rapidly depletes battery power. Obviously though, right, no fault of LaCie there!I've never had any problems with LaCie before, didn't expect any with this, and it works perfectly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sicuro protetto antigraffio, possibilità di upgrade hdd con ssd 1 Tb a fine garanzia
reviews.reviewText: Il prodotto si presenta così come sul sito del venditore di facile installazione e configurazione, spedizione veloce in uno due giorni mi è già arrivato a casa, silenzioso, le protezioni impermiabili mettono al sicuro di umidità le parti scoperte come l'unico ingresso usb 3.0 frontale mentre la thunderbolth è riavvolgibile intorno alla protezione gommosa e a sua volta è protetta da un guscio estraibile. Prodotto eccellente! Rimane da capire, una volta scaduta la garanzia se c'è la possibilità di sostituire l'HDD interno da 1 Tb con un SSD della stessa capienza.
